review_title: Supportive employer, lovely place to work
pros: Supportive management style Opportunities for development Flexible Friendly team
cons: None - I am happy here

pros: There was a positive team practice
cons: Little carer development Little vision

review_title: Fantastic company who truly cares about their people
pros:
When I joined Hafod, I had such a warm welcome from the team. There is a very supportive and caring culture where every one helps each other. 

Having the option to work a 9 day fortnight with flexible working has significantly improved my work-life balance, in addition to many other benefits such as Medicash which has saved me so much money!

Hafod really cares about their people and always has opportunities for development, such as attending courses run by the Academi, joining lunch time learnings with the innovation team or simply having the opportunity to have a chat with management to identify areas for development and then putting a plan in place. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend working with Hafod.
cons: Can't think of any cons.

pros: Flexible working in a role which helps
cons: Fast changing situations and landscape during COVID-19

job_title: Learning and Development Officer in Cardiff, Wales
pros:
If you want to work with people who share the company's purpose and values, then Hafod is your place. I work across central services departments on a daily basis and it's clear to identify peoples' passion and genuine care for why they do what they do.

In addition to this, there is a great culture for personal development. As well as formal opportunities, there is a great focus on job satisfaction and the autonomy to dabble into other areas of the business to gain knowledge and experience to help you grow as an individual.
cons: This is an organisation that has grown and succeeded due to the passion of the people, and certainly not for it's systems. This is all changing and the transformation team are doing a fantastic job at supporting this, but of course it takes a bit of time. Already I've noticed a significant change in the right direction.

pros:
Very welcoming team
Supportive approach to work
Encouraging with personal development
cons: None so far! I like it here

pros: Flexi days , decent chief exec and parking
cons: Never in my career have I worked in a place like this, many managers are toxic bullies. Yelling and swearing at staff is common. Micromanaged beyond belief and impossible to get listened to unless your face fits. Pay is pretty poor as well.

review_title: Good company if they want to be
pros:
Friendly working environment 
Good staff
cons: Changed the job I applied for

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Cardiff, Wales
pros: Lovely people doing good work, good working conditions, management that is supportive of work life balance, employee wellbeing and professional development.
cons:
Under-investment in IT systems has created many problems during COVID and makes working from home frustrating at times, although efforts are being made to address this by the organisation.
The organisation is made up of smaller organisations that merged a few years ago and it shows, strategic alignment and business planning is still disjointed with some siloh working and sub cultures.

review_title: Bully is rife in this company
job_title: Human Resources Advisor in Cardiff, Wales
pros: Convenient location, nice office, free tea and coffee
cons: Bullying by managers, scared to report culture, lack of genuine care to customers and staff

job_title: Learning and Development in Cardiff, Wales
pros: Everyone is so friendly, genuine and passionate! Such a great ethos! Encourage you to progress and get involved in exciting new projects and training. Good, flexible hours.
cons: I can't think of any!

review_title: No sick pay and employee holidays differ depending on your role.
pros: The training is good and kept up to date.
cons:
If you are an office worker, the benefits are excellent. If you work in any position that is care or support, there are no benefits. The pay scale is terrible, don't expect to be paid sick pay unless you work in the office even though your a front line worker. Only excpect the basic holiday entitlement again unless your office staff.
It is not one Hafod, it depends on your role

pros: There was a great team of staff, but totally overshadowed by the clueless company
cons: Minimum wage. Long shifts. Zero appreciation.

pros: Excellent company to work for with an extremely supportive workforce.
cons: Nothing to report as far.

review_title: A genuinely lovely place to work
pros:
I go in every day and enjoy myself because the people are genuinely lovely. 

I love what the company is about and are trying to do, senior management and the CEO are very visible also which I think is very important, you never get a feeling that they're too high up or busy to speak with you.

The company benefits are very generous compared to a lot of organisations I've worked in and there does feel like the opportunity to grow within your role (and not just be stuck where you are).

People have been nothing but welcoming and supportive to me, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it as a place to work.
cons: Some processes and ways of working are quite manual, Hafod could benefit from moving with the times a bit with respect to IT and systems.

pros: Great to work with the elderly, always learning on the spot, love hearing stories of peoples lives and building that relationship. Full training given. Care wage is never brilliant and we dont do it for the money but some sort of acknowledgement like carer of the month or a good word your way would benefit carers attitude towards their job.
cons: Communication is always a struggle but when you work part time its inevitable. Need some sort of encouragement to make you glad you work there other than the gratification of helping others (which is great dont get me wrong), but knowing management appreciate you for what you do especially during Covid-19 would just boost morale.

review_title: A great company, going through rapid change, for the better.
pros:
Feel that you are making a difference to people's lives
Excellent work/life balance with true flexibility 
High trust aspect
Good salary and other benefits compared to some other companies
New Leadership team - time of exciting change
cons:
A lot going on can lead to stinted or poor communications
Change is happening quickly 
Engagement levels are low due to some changes taking place to quick, or without robust communication
Historic issues contributing to lack of engagement

pros: It's a great place to work with very good terms and conditions and lots of development opportunities. It's also very rewarding as no matter where you work you know that you are contributing to delivering our mission of Making Lives Better for our tenants and the people we support and care for.
cons: Time flies by too quickly!

pros:
Great place to work if you're looking to begin your career and work your way up. 

There are lots of opportunities in a variety of jobs roles across the company which you can have exposure to. 

Out of the jobs I've had this has been the most supportive and friendly working environment I've been in.  I would recommend working at Hafod to everyone!
cons: No flextime available although we do have the option of working a 9 day fortnight!

pros: Hafod really lives up to the family friendly organisation. I have been really supported in my role whilst raising a young family.  That isn't the only perk,  Hafod really invests in staff development,  whether that is within your current role or another role within  the business.
cons: IT systems are a little dated - We will really benefit from a HR self service function to manage things like holiday entitlement etc.

pros: Hafod is a company that looks to invest in and develop their staff. They care about improving lives for both it's service users and the people supporting them.
cons: Being in the care sector means there can be a high turn over of staff both on the ground and at head office.

pros:
Excellent development opportunities
Great support from managers
provides regular training keeping all staff up to date
Good terms and conditions.
non blame culture
cons:
Do not pay sick leave for some staff
No enhancements for nights or weekends.

job_title: Registered Care Manager in Cwmbran, Wales
